Package com.github.miachm.sods

Class Sheet

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.miachm.sods.Sheet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Sheet>
    public class Sheet
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Sheet>
    Represents a sheet in a Spreadsheet. You can create empty sheets and add to an existing Spreadsheet

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Sheet​(java.lang.String name)
      Create an empty sheet with a given name.
      Sheet​(java.lang.String name, int rows, int columns)
      Create an empty sheet with a given name and dimmensions

        columns - Number of columns in the sheet
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the number of rows/columns are negative
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the number of rows/columns are negative

        public void deleteColumns​(int column,
                          int howmany)
        Delete a number of columns starting in a specific index
        Parameters:
        column - The column index to start
        howmany - The number of columns to be deleted
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If columns + howmany is out bounds of the sheet. No changes will be done to the sheet
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if howmany is negative, no changes will be done to the sheet

        Throws:

      • getRange

        public Range getRange​(int row,
                      int column,
                      int numRows)
        Obtains a @Range which represents a number of rows starting in a specific Cell. Note: This function only take the first column of every row
        Parameters:
        row - X Coordinate of the starting cell
        column - Y Coordinate of the starting cell
        numRows - How many rows to take
        Returns:
        A range which represents the cell
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if it represents a invalid range
        See Also:
        getRange(int, int, int, int)

      • getRange

        public Range getRange​(int row,
                      int column,
                      int numRows,
                      int numColumns)
        Obtains a @Range which represents a subset of the Sheet.
        Parameters:
        row - X Coordinate of the starting cell
        column - Y Coordinate of the starting cell
        numRows - How many rows to take
        numColumns - How many columns to take
        Returns:
        A range which represents the cell
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if it represents a invalid range

      • getRange

        public Range getRange​(java.lang.String a1Notation)
        Obtains a @Range using the A1 Notation format. A1 notation is a string representation of a subset in a Spreadsheet where the column is represented by a capital letter (starting in A) and the row by a row number (starting in 1). For example, you would write: "B3" to obtain the Cell of column B and row 3. You would write "A2:D2" to obtain the cells between A2 and D2 (included). Inconsistent ranges ("C2:A3") are reinterpreted when it's possible. In the example would be ("A3:C2")
        Parameters:
        a1Notation - The string representation of the range in A1Notation
        Returns:
        The range requested
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the argument is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the argument is not a valid A1Notation
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If it represents a invalid range

      • setColumnWidth

        public void setColumnWidth​(int column,
                           java.lang.Double width)
        Set a specific column width to a specific column
        Parameters:
        column - The index of the column
        width - The width of the column. It can be a null if you want to "unset" the width
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the column is negative or >= numColumns
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Width has to be positive

      • setColumnWidths

        public void setColumnWidths​(int column,
                            int numColumns,
                            java.lang.Double width)
        Set a column width to a specific set of columns
        Parameters:
        column - The index of the column
        numColumns - The number of columns to be modified, starting on index.
        width - The width of the column. It can be a null if you want to "unset" the width
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the column is negative or >= numColumns
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Width and numColumns has to be positive

      • setRowHeight

        height - The height of the row. It can be a null if you want to "unset" the height
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the row is negative or >= numRows
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Height has to be positive

      • setRowHeights

                          int numRows,
                          java.lang.Double height)
        Set a row height to a specific set of rows
        Parameters:
        row - The index of the row
        numRows - The number of rows to be modified, starting on index.
        height - The height of the row. It can be a null if you want to "unset" the row
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the row is negative or >= numRows
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Height has to be positive

      • trim

        public void trim()
        Deprecated.
        This function should not be called since it won't make any visible difference to the user. This is going to be moved to private visibility
        Trim the sheet removing unused rows/columns

      • isProtected

        public boolean isProtected()
        Determines if this sheet is protected by a password or not
        Returns:
        True if it's protected

      • setPassword

        public void setPassword​(java.lang.String key)
                 throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Sets a password for a sheet. SODS will ignore this setting but other consumers will ask for a password to the user in order to access this sheet
        Parameters:
        key - the password. Sets the password to null to disable the password protection
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the password parameter is empty
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if your java installation doesn't have SHA-256 hash encryption
